alert.note: Alert for Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 6:36PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Okeechobee and southern Osceola Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Kissimmee Prarie Preserve, or 13 miles northwest of Basinger, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kissimmee Prarie Preserve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
